website_summaries.verdict: With a split keyboard ergonomic layout, multimedia controls, Windows hotkeys, and  a built-in touch pad, this unit includes every feature most users want in an attractive, professional-looking model.
pros: Control audio and video files with one-touch buttons
Touch pad on wrist rest operates like a touch pad or mouse
The ergonomic wave design and split keyboard layout prevent unnatural wrist position while typing
The wired USB means users need not worry about losing connection while working
cons: Some keys may stick or "hang up" for very fast typists, causing letters to display in the opposite order of which they were typed

website_summaries.verdict: The Adesso Tru-Form Pro is a decent introduction to split keyboards, but there are more comfortable models that cost less.
pros: Split design more comfortable than traditional keyboards
quick-launch keys cut down on mousing

customer_reviews.title: A great ergonomic keyboard, but what for space considerations
customer_reviews.text: I love this. The keys feel soft and comfortable. For people not used to an ergonomic keyboard, you might find it difficult to make the adjustment. But once you do, it is a much more comfortable position for a great deal of typing. Keep in mind that the curved shape may take up more room that a conventional keyboard. I have a keyboard shelf on my desk and it just fits. If your current keyboard is snug, this might not fit. I love that it has a ten key and a touchpad for when I need them. No regrets on this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ellerbee

customer_reviews.title: My favorite keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the keyboard on my laptop which the cat had destroyed. However, it didn't really work. However, I took it to my office, replaced the flat board, and it is great. easy to use, and so ergo perfect. It is NOT wireless (and doesn't need to be) . I think you have to press a little harder on these keys - if you are a soft typist, it will take you a few minutes to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: abc

customer_reviews.title: Decades of Adesso
customer_reviews.text: I started using their split/contoured/touchpad keyboards decades ago, as I was suffering from mouse-itis big time -- seeing the chiropractor weekly to straighten out my neck. It totally solved my neck problem. My first one lasted 5 years, subsequent ones, made in China, not so long-lasting. The latest one came out of the box with a sticky "g" key. Problem is now I have a Windows10 laptop and this keyboard is not W10 compatible. So I'm looking at the 450UB. Anybody have anything to say about that?
customer_reviews.author: Cathie Clark

customer_reviews.title: I love the design
customer_reviews.text: I love the design. The problem, however, lies in the fact this keyboard dies very quickly. In less than a year I have purchased three of them, the first of which I had to return because it did not function. The problem is that the keys stick and continue to do so. The left mouse key on the last two that I have purchased gets stuck and will not unstick. I removed said key and the spring beneath that key appears to be non-functioning and permanently jammed. I would advise against this keyboard on the fact that it's simply will not last for any extended period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Family of Coussan and Richard

customer_reviews.title: Functionality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard with great expectations. I'd always wanted and ergonomic keyboard but never needed it. All my previous keyboards were indestructible, they just lasted and lasted and so I never had the need. Now that I have the need for a keyboard, which I bought just this past September, it is malfunctioning ALREADY. I've only had it since September, 2018. When has anyone had a keyboard last four months or less and have it die on you? So will I be able to have it replaced or return it for my money back? Need-less-to-say I am extremely DISAPPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: Online purchases

customer_reviews.title: Touch pad relieves carpel tunnel
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for years on two home desktops which get heavy use. They seem to last about four years before some of the keys get funky. We like the key function and the touch pad. We are always amused when visitors use the touch pad and complain as it does take an hour or so to get use to it if you are use to a conventional mouse. A mouse stirs up my wife's carpel tunnel which does not occur with the touch pad.
customer_reviews.author: MED

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS KEYBOARD, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this Adesso ergonomic keyboard for more than a decade. I love it, have always loved it. The touch pad instead of a mouse is BRILLIANT - saved my neck and shoulder from certain disaster. I've had several of them. And I swear by them. However, when my last one burned out (after many years - no complaint there) I ordered a new one, but I'm not sure it's interfacing properly with my computer. Not sure where the problem lies. Maybe the keyboard is ahead of the computer or the computer is ahead of the keyboard, but problems continue to arise. It's hard to discover where the fault lies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... I type this and couldn't have bought a more nice piece of gadgetry
customer_reviews.text: I am using it as I type this and couldn't have bought a more nice piece of gadgetry!! I learned on one of these and couldn't wait to have another and when the opportunity presented itself, I couldn't pass it up. It's comfortable, a tad bit on the big side, but all the features are PERFECT!! And everything is just as I had hoped for!! I looked at a couple of other good choices, but this one just seemed like it was the best fit for my work and myself. I would recommend this to ANYONE!!!! If anything should happen to this one, I have no problem buying this one again!!! LOVE IT!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Flipsing

customer_reviews.title: Touchpad stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Initial impressions were very good construction and everything worked very well. After two weeks of use, the touchpad stopped working properly. The scroll functions also stopped working. We ultimately ended up returning the keyboard within the 30 day return window. It’s unfortunate that the touchpad stopped working as it was a perfect solution for a narrow keyboard drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse L

customer_reviews.title: Amazing while it worked
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this keyboard for an employee that has been having wrist issues and up until a couple of weeks ago it has worked perfectly and she has been very satisfied with it. Like many other reviews have noted, the track pad has stopped working about a month after the return window closed. If you are looking for an integrated keyboard that will last, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Redding 1.

customer_reviews.title: Mouse pad quit after a few months.  Otherwise good keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Liked the comfort of the keyboard but the mouse pad went haywire and doesn't always work. I went back to a regular mouse. Otherwise the keyboard has been good. Wish it had worked better. Next time I think I will buy the roller ball keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for quite a while. They seem to be the only split keyboard with a touch pad in the center. They had some quality control problems for a while as some of the keyboards I received had some issues. This keyboard works great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Boom

customer_reviews.title: Comfy Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard. I like that it comes with a trackpad and right/left mouse click. I will say that the right and left click are a bit noisy and stiff but over time maybe that will get better. Shows scratches easily on the wrist pad area, non-key areas so just be aware of that. Overall good keyboard and I would buy it again. I've seen no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Beeen

customer_reviews.title: The concept is great. The quality of the keyboard is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered my fourth (or fifth?) one. The keys are squishy. Buttons stop working, especially the left- and right-click buttons below the touchpad. But other ones stop working too. I'm buying a couple per year, it seems. So why buy another one? Because it is ergonomic and it has a touchpad under the space bar, where a touchpad belongs. If a company makes a keyboard with mechanical-non-mushy keys that aren't squishy and don't break, ergonomic form, and puts the touchpad under the space bars, where it belongs, I would pay hundreds. It would be a dream come true. I'm on computers constantly. Just like everyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keys are erratic, trackpad worse
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to replace the same model keyboard that I have had for 8 years. This specific one is defective. Another one arrived and I will try it out. What makes me most concerned is that some problems like erratic track pad functioning only developed after about two weeks. I really like this model of keyboard but can't stand one key "screaming at me" and the others being quiet and the sudden closing of windows and strange behavior that has developed (from the track pad). Can't wait to see my old type of keyboard ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard Purchased
customer_reviews.text: In Order to give staff full access to their work space table top, I had to secure their SFF PC underneath their workstation, and by doing that. Standard USB Cable Keyboard and mouse could not reach the PC. The Tru-Form Pro Ergonomic Contour TouchPad USB Keyboard/mouse was the perfect item to buy for staff. the USB WiFi is strong and not having cables running across their workspace is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: GLMC

customer_reviews.title: loud, 20th-century, but an effective tool
customer_reviews.text: I used the Microsoft ergonomic keyboard for years and I prefer its touch, but it wouldn't fit on the keyboard tray of my new desk. This Adesso is taking some getting used to, and at first I didn't trust it ... especially with passwords, I didn't always feel confident that a keystroke had been successful (usually it had been). (One keycap needed to be removed and reseated, but that fixed it nicely.) It's a bit loud, too -- definitely 20th century -- but it works as an ergonomic tool and my wrists like it. The touchpad is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: travel in place

customer_reviews.title: Note the change to the key mechanism
customer_reviews.text: My fourth keyboard of this design. As the box says, the key action is slightly different, dampened by a silicon rubber mechanism. This new mechanism requires more finger pressure but aids in faster typing. Others note keyboard is quieter and it is, but far from silent.
customer_reviews.author: Videodog

customer_reviews.title: Great design, really poor construction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard 6 weeks ago and it is already useless. The design is excellent and really helps my shoulder, which had been in pain from mouse use, but it is poorly constructed and has already completely lost the ability to highlight anything. I am a translator and need to move phrases around in the sentence as I work. I can no longer use the touch pad. The clicker does not work.
customer_reviews.author: A. Celmer

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I am using this kind of keyboard for several years. Cannot use anything different due to some limitations. They never last for more than a year, usually— for 6 to 9 months, then the mouse fails. I wish they come up with better mouse
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: great keyboard, I like everything about it except... sometimes a key will double or triple strike while your typing something out, doesn't happen too often but enough to be irritating at times.
customer_reviews.author: Workaholic

customer_reviews.title: Adesso Tru-Form Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboards--and can't live without having one. That is why I purchase nearly one every year, even though they just don't last! I don't know why Adesso can't make these keyboards to last, or someone else can't make one that will last. The ergonomic design is perfect, I love having the touchpad so easy to reach. They are perfect as far as design, but the mechanics just do not last. If I hadn't read so many reviews that also state this problem, I would think it was just me, but it's not!
customer_reviews.author: Mincks 2

customer_reviews.title: Toilet bowl.
customer_reviews.text: Was working fine but took a dump about 17 months after I purchased it. It just stopped working and the manufactures warranty is for 12 months.
customer_reviews.author: Benny HaHa

customer_reviews.title: HARD TO USE
customer_reviews.text: I would like to return this product, unfortunately, it did not get to my internal office until 4 weeks after it had been ordered. This product is very hard to use. The track pad does not track very well and the keyboard layout is hard to get accustomed to. Plus it takes up a lot of desk space. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Bill Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful keyboard! This ergonomically-correct keyboard really makes a difference ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful keyboard! This ergonomically-correct keyboard really makes a difference in the comfort-level of wrists and arms for those who spend any amount of time typing. It is lightweight and very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Koon

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone down big time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because I wanted to try the touchpad. I've been using it for a couple months now. My previous keyboard was the same design and from Adesso, but didn't have the touch pad. It was a GREAT keyboard. This one IS NOT! It's definitely a lot cheaper build. They've gone too far cutting costs and the quality has suffered greatly. Some keys won't rebound well, others feel mushy. The overall feeling is cheap. The touchpad is ok, nothing special. I'm going to go back to my old keyboard, crumbs and all.
customer_reviews.author: S Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Smooth typing!
customer_reviews.text: I received this on time this past weekend, and was able to test the keyboard out yesterday and I am very pleased and satisfied with how easy it was to install, and the typing was smooth and didn't hurt my wrists either. I work a 8-9 hour office job (that requires a lot of typing and data entry). The keyboard is very very comfortable and easy to use. I'm so happy I own this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is horrible! We ordered 4 of these for the office. Within a week, one of them was already malfunctioning. Some keys were sticking and others weren't working at all. Now not even 10 months later, 2 more are having the same issue. Only have 30 days to return so we are out $170 and have to purchase more keyboards. BEWARE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: sheriff

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT IN EVERY RESPECT
customer_reviews.text: I'm a translator. I often transcribe long conversations spoken by people with differing accents and speech patterns. I am also a very fast typist. I need a keyboard that can keep my wrists relaxed while allowing me speed and accuracy and this one does a perfect job. The one I'm using right now is 4 years old and still in great shape. When it dies, which will happen some day, I'll buy another Adesso.
customer_reviews.author: mariposah

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, bad mouse button.
customer_reviews.text: Nice keyboard. I need the trackpad because my of tennis elbow from working with a mouse. Too bad, the track pad's left mouse button lost its click action. It can be pressed but it is flat and squishy. Too bad. I'll have to replace Update: I am on my second keyboard and left mouse button is again deflated ( as are my spirits) Adesso will warranty replace but the shipping is expensive that I am required to pay.
customer_reviews.author: AI

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for touchpad but dont even use it. Doesnt move that smoothly, Keyboard ok
customer_reviews.author: Paul L.

customer_reviews.title: Overall good.
customer_reviews.text: I love that this keyboard does not have the extra function key that you have to press along with the F1 - F12 buttons, and it is sturdy. What I don't like is that the touchpad is unreliable. Changing usb ports helped for a while, but now I've used all three of my usb ports, and it's still very jumpy and hard to control.
customer_reviews.author: LGordon

customer_reviews.title: Loud But Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Keys are loud when you type on this keyboard. I work in a quiet office and everyone knows when I am typing something. The keyboard is comfortable though so I don't mind putting up with the co-workers complaints. If you ask me, it keeps them awake. I'm happy with this keyboard. I like the mousepad feature on it but not quite sure when I would need to use it since I have a regular mouse right next to it. The sleep and wake up buttons are a nice feature too.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Houshour

customer_reviews.title: Provides relief from strain
customer_reviews.text: I've been having a lot of shoulder issues from repetitive tasks at work. After using this keyboard for a couple of weeks, there is noticeable relief from some of the types of strain I was experiencing. I like the mouse pad located under the space bars. It's easy to use with either hand, and I like not having to grip a regular mouse all day. This keyboard is a bit large which makes it somewhat cumbersome if workspace is limited. The general shape is comfortable, the split keyboard affords a more natural position when typing and adjusting to it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara K. Powers

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with repeating keys on this keyboard, meaning I would hit a key or the spacebar and it would register multiple times. I requested a replacement and the second one works just fine. I have no problem with the touchpad, although the scroll function on the right side of the touchpad is extremely sensitive. Overall, I am happy with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returning
customer_reviews.text: I like the design of this keyboard an the functionality of having the touchpad. However the space bar has not worked since I got it out of the box. It double spaces about everything other time I hit it, which causes me to have to go back and edit most everything I write...as evidenced by all the double spacing in this review.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Butters

customer_reviews.title: Quality Assurance
customer_reviews.text: Just received my keyboard. I only had to pop off 5 keys and put them back where they belong. Don't throw your old keyboard away too fast so that you can use it to copy the QWERTY layout as needed. This may only be annoying to touch typists. As another reviewer mentioned, at least it is pretty fixable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. I've had back issue for years from using a mouse and this keyboard alleviates that problem. Because the mouse is in the middle of the keyboard and not off to the side, I don't have the back/shoulder pain anymore.
customer_reviews.author: SarahDzik

customer_reviews.title: Works well for about 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 8/2016. Was working perfectly. Just started to notice that the left click button is getting sluggish, probably from repeated use in a work setting. Based on this, I’d say the longevity of this item is about 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Tachiyomi

customer_reviews.title: I bought this keyboard for the ergonomic mouse - but ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for the ergonomic mouse - but I just traded one problem for another. The keyboard is really deep. I have a pull out keyboard tray out so far to reach all the keys so that I am sitting a foot away from my desk. Awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this keyboard for my employee on Feb 11th. She said two of the buttons are already broken and don't work. I have no way of getting in touch with the seller. It just says I can't return it since it has been past 30 days. If you are selling me junk I should have the right to return it past 30 days! I would go with another brand and with another seller if I were you!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great! I love the ergonomics of it. I used to have problems with elbow pain from being on the keyboard all day. This keyboard eliminated that pain. The keyboard is solid and has a quality feel. The integrated keypad makes transitioning to mouse entry easy. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: jcgardengirl

customer_reviews.title: Limited lifespan, trackpad usb issues, but nice shape & convenient trackpad
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few of these; they all have had limited lifespans but I like the shape and the builtin trackpad. This is not advertised to work with Macs but seriously it's a USB keyboard. What are standards for? In my case, with my 2014 MacBook pro, the keyboard works fine but the trackpad does not work when plugged into a USB 2 or USB 3 hub. That's pretty inexcusable; I've had other keyboards and mice plugged in to both hubs with no problems. It all works well when plugged directly into the computer's USB port.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M. Dreyer

customer_reviews.title: I'l happily pay 3x for a high-quality version of this keyboard ...
customer_reviews.text: 5-stars for the layout, 1 or 2 stars for the quality. I'l happily pay 3x for a high-quality version of this keyboard instead of replacing it every 12-months.
customer_reviews.author: PJ19

customer_reviews.title: So far, So good
customer_reviews.text: Day 2 and so far, I love this keyboard. The height is great, the keys seem mechanical instead of pressure and the clicking (although quiet) is louder than the cheap keyboards. I really hope this lasts a bit longer than the last 2 MS 4000 (which was 18 months and 9 months respectively)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is clunky and makes a ton of noise when you type. Occasionally it just shuts off for no reason and the power button will not work. You have to unplug it and plug it back in do reboot it. Not worth the money, I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Angelalala

customer_reviews.title: Returned due to glitchy response
customer_reviews.text: The buttons stuck from day one. I would get multiple “G” when I typed it and sometimes no “T”. The mouse stopped scrolling after about 3 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Goss

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed that after only a year the letters are coming ...
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed that after only a year the letters are coming off the keyboard. I bought this for a friend at work because her old keyboard literally had holes in the keys from wear and tear. Now it looks like this one is going to wear out quickly too.
customer_reviews.author: Sue M.

customer_reviews.title: Inoperable, up on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard will not power on. It's a large paperweight. No indication, that the keyboard did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Nickel

customer_reviews.title: and the ergonomics suit me just fine. My employer bought me one for work
customer_reviews.text: As far as I'm concerned, this is THE keyboard to own. I much prefer the trackpad to a mouse, and the ergonomics suit me just fine. My employer bought me one for work, and I bought myself one for home.
customer_reviews.author: Marty H

customer_reviews.title: The only ergonomic keyboard with a touchpad
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because we have a few people who need an ergonomic keyboard and a touchpad. This conveniently places them together on the same keyboard allowing for less desk clutter. The keyboard and touchpad work well, and work with Windows 8.1. Nothing to compare it to, so we'll keep buying these as we need them.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Miller

customer_reviews.title: My 5th one
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid key board. I prefer the touch pad for desktop and laptop and have these keys boards at home with my wife and at work. I do wish they would go back to the touch pad on the right so I don't have to move my hand as much. Touch mouse with a good chair and good arms rests is much easier on the hand.
customer_reviews.author: NNason

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I end up buying a new keyboard at least yearly and have purchased the same model numerous times. Keyboards wear out. Rather than paying big bucks and trying to make it last years, I buy this moderatly priced keyboard and replace it when needed. The touch pad is essential for me.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Wish the keys were a little more responsive but overall I really love the keyboard. I haven't had any issues with it
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. I can type twice as fast on this as I can on a regular keyboard. Love it. It does take a bit of getting used to but once you do you too will love it. This is my second Ergonomic keyboard and I will never use any other kind.
customer_reviews.author: OldJoys

customer_reviews.title: Key action excellent. Not wireless.
customer_reviews.text: Would get 5 starts, except from the illustrations I thought it was wireless. This has a usb cord. Key action for typing is great.
customer_reviews.author: mb7825

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Touch pad section is of poor quality. Doesn't work smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Original Settler

customer_reviews.title: A unique product
customer_reviews.text: over the past 10+ years, I've purchased a few versions of this keyboard, and always found the same thing. the integrated touchpad is unique in the market, reducing clutter on the desk, and reducing shoulder strain from repetition. I've just received this newer version of the Adesso and in spite of some negative reviews on this site, found that it's install was flawless and my wife was thrilled. Only reason for not giving it 5 stars is that the keys/touch are a bit noisy and not six-sigma engineering. But for $65, sheesh, get over it!
customer_reviews.author: Farbeyond Publishing LLC

customer_reviews.title: great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: It's just like my old Adesso keyboard. The old one has been working great for 6 years now, I bought the new one so that I can have the same (almost the same) at home, and my office.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: BOUGHT ANOTHER BRAND AND WAS VERY UNHAPPY AND SO I ORDERED AN ADESSO AND I'M A HAPPY CAMPER AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS MY 2ND ADEESO KEYBOARD. THE 1ST LASTED FOR YEARS OF SERVICE UNTIL I DROPPED A FULL GLASS OS LEMONADE ON IT. BOUGHT ANOTHER BRAND AND WAS VERY UNHAPPY AND SO I ORDERED AN ADESSO AND I'M A HAPPY CAMPER AGAIN. I LOVE THE ERGONOMIC SHAPE OF THIS BOARD AND IT IS VERY KIND TO MY ARTHRITIC HANDS!! A WONDERFUL PRODUCT AND THE SERVICE WAS GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Apitzsch

customer_reviews.title: Much better than keyboard with separate mouse
customer_reviews.text: I work a desk job and have been having problems with my neck and right shoulder for years. I was seeing a physical therapist for this and she commented that the problem might be stemming from reaching for my mouse. I tried alternating the mouse from the right to left, but then noticed pain in my left shoulder. I purchased this about a month ago and am pleasantly surprised at how much better I feel. The touch pad does take some getting used to, but once you get it down it seems like you can actually maneuver a lot faster.
customer_reviews.author: DRow

customer_reviews.title: Consistent performer 2nd unit
customer_reviews.text: Bit pricey but does the job well with intergrated touchpad.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy613

customer_reviews.title: Does not play well with Win10, very frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much a crap keyboard that takes a lot of work arounds... not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: William C Siebersma

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I've used this same keyboard at work for the past two years and it's great. Helps with the ergonomic positioning. Now that I've been given the option to work from home, I purchased the same keyboard. Plug n play is great for the technically challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Paper Artist

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: love this keyboard. Still having problems getting my fingers in the right place. BUT it seems more natural and my wrists don't hurt as much.
customer_reviews.author: lmt2094

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Have bought many of the same, and always happy with the product. No tiring of hands / arms / wrists. Works great for long hours of typing. Does not take long at all to get used to typing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kate from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Ehh...
customer_reviews.text: Very uncomfortable and bulky. Would prefer a diff't model with a soft wrist pad. Although the touch pad is useful if using the keyboard on a laptop. Pointless if you're using on a desktop
customer_reviews.author: Mark E. Twiz

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this...cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Keys are sticky and loud. Random letters that I didn't touch would be inserted while I was typing. Mouse pad is ok, but feels very cheap. Overall a cheap product that I returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: This Keyboard Saves Wrists
customer_reviews.text: I work in IT and spend endless hours on the computer every day. This ergonomic keyboard has the exact set up I need to alleviate the wrist pain caused by all the mouse-driven applications and unlike other ergonomic keyboards I've tried the keyboard is laid out correctly for shorter fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Crouse

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy on the hands and wrists. Works with every pc I've tried it with.
customer_reviews.author: ZonaBoy

customer_reviews.title: you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased for a 911 center. The keyboards are used on a 24/7 basis and are very durable. If you use it for home or work, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard works fine, but would be better if the touchpad were ...
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard works fine, but would be better if the touchpad were located on the right side of the keyboard instead of in the middle. Otherwise this is a good keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Janice O.

customer_reviews.title: Like the mouse feature (that's the main reason I purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: Like the mouse feature (that's the main reason I purchased it), but the keys are a bit loud and "clack". I bought it for use at work, but I work in an open office and it was too loud, so I now use it at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great budget keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I own. Best combo keyboard out there.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Dannels

customer_reviews.title: Not so bad as it's been painted
customer_reviews.text: As usual, people who got defective units are always the first to write reviews. Can't blame them, really, but it may give a distorted notion of the product. I've just bought my second one. Had the first a number of years. It didn't fail; I wrecked it by spilling glue on it. The new one has a greatly improved touch, which it needed. The touchpad keys are now at the bottom instead of on the side, which I liked, but I'll get used to it. The "hot keys" I may never use. Altogether an improved, quality unit. If this is what you want, I think you may buy without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Leubrie

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool.
customer_reviews.text: Feels just like the old one I had and used heavily for 10 years, but it has more conveniences.
customer_reviews.author: M Wiles

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea - Not Well Executed
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but the touchpad is not good enough and the keys on the keyboard stick and feel cheap. Really tried to like it but finally had to give up.
customer_reviews.author: TCB

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard won't even turn on followed the directions and still can't use it
customer_reviews.author: Judy g

customer_reviews.title: a couple of the keys feel and sound loose everytime i hit them...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't feel solid on all the keys. a couple are loose sounding...
customer_reviews.author: MGM

customer_reviews.title: So helpful and easy to use & setup
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has helped the pain in my arms so much!
customer_reviews.author: Chris George

customer_reviews.title: Return was easy.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it. Several keys stuck and would either print double or not at all. Return was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Kotzias

customer_reviews.title: I love the keyboard and how it works
customer_reviews.text: I love the keyboard and how it works. The only drawback is the left mouse click wears out WAY before the rest of the keyboard. I've been using this type keyboard for over ten years but have to buy a replacement keyboard about every 1 to 2 years. It's the only brand of keyboard I know like this so I keep coming back. Wish they would make the mouse click more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Lucas

customer_reviews.title: works for me
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard takes some getting use to but my hands already have more feeling back. I wish they had a wireless of the same model.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Worst feeling keyboard I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Terrible stay away unless you are still living in the 90's
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is my third keyboard over 10+ years. Without this keyboard with built in touchpad I would have had to have surgery on my wrists -- I'm on the key board all day long without any pain. Not everyone feels comfortable using the split keyboard and touchpad -- but it's absolutely wonderful. I just hope they will continue to make since I wear them out every 3-4 years. Thanks for a great product!! E
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Great feel
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has a great feel and works extremely well. I especially like having the mouse pad in the center.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: Within three weeks of use the "mouse pad area" is ...
customer_reviews.text: Within three weeks of use the "mouse pad area" is faulty, the surface of the area is rough requiring harder pressure which slows down my performance. The left mouse click would sometimes work, and sometimes not. Have quit using. :(
customer_reviews.author: Tina Menchey

customer_reviews.title: After only a few weeks of use, the key for the number 9 and the "(" symbol went soft and does not lift when depressed.
customer_reviews.text: I love the style of this keyboard, and the last one I had lasted for years. I replaced it only when the touchpad failed. This new exact replacement had a key failure after only a few weeks of general light use. I am not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good keyboard for those that do not like the standard keyboard. It is also an easier keyboard to train a new typer on.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great. Except it has PS2 connections
customer_reviews.text: You'd think for the price you'd get a nice, ergonomic keyboard that you'd be able to use on a computer made after 2000. Had to buy adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Cluczak

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard & Touchpad
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the feel of the keys and the placement of the Touch Pad is not in a user friendly place. It should be under the up, down, right and left keys between the letters and the numbers. I have returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: VAllen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, I just did not realize how much ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, I just did not realize how much I dislike the mouse pad, so other than that, the keyboard is super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Valentin Caraballo

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable for the long hours that I type and super great on price.
customer_reviews.author: Stallyon

customer_reviews.title: I expected better from Adesso
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard was flaky, stuck keys. I expected better from Adesso. Returned for full credit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: I first came to use this keyboard when my employer's ergonomic staff recommended it. After a few days of adjusting to the different style I came to love it. I spend a good part of my day typing and could not do it without this. The central touchpad is instrumental in keeping me pain free. I suffer from neck and back issues and the repetitive lateral motion related to the use of a traditional mouse causes me great pain within an hour. I highly recommend the use of this keyboard to anyone that experiences pain related to neck, shoulder or wrist injuries made worse by a traditional keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A VERY NICE KEYBOARD I LOVE THE MOUSE TOUCH PAD
customer_reviews.author: Loyd Boren

customer_reviews.title: Way too bulky
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is huge! It barely fit onto the under-the-deck platform and location of the touchpad was awkward. I bought a $19 keyboard at Wal Mart and Ergo Touchpad from an Amazon vendor and they are serving me well.
customer_reviews.author: Teach

customer_reviews.title: ergo keyboard
customer_reviews.text: i ordered this thinking it was wireless but found out it wasnt so i returned it because i was looking for wireless keyboard, otherwise it seemed fine if your are looking for a keyboard like this as a wired..
customer_reviews.author: Mindy H

customer_reviews.title: NOT A GOOD CHOICE FOR ME
customer_reviews.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said? The product was scratched when it was delivered, but that's not the reason I returned it. Sticky keys, finger pain, the wrist rest isn't padded like it appears in the pic, etc. I had high hopes for this keyboard. The seller was super cool though and I had no problems with the return. I added an extra star due to the seller being cool and for quickly responding to my concerns. I think this keyboard could work well for small kids, for learning to type or as a play keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The old one wore out after 7 years or so I ordered the newest version of the same keyboard. It is perfect for my writing and spreadsheet needs. Very few errors due to fine key layout unlike the many errors I make on standard keyboards. Mousepad and layout saves a lot of effort and my stress on my hands.
customer_reviews.author: CPA computer guy

product_meta.title: Adesso PCK-308UB - Tru-Form Pro Ergonomic Contour TouchPad USB Keyboard Black with Hotkeys
product_meta.description:
Built with an integrated touchpad, this multipurpose ergonomic keyboard is the perfect solution and space saver for any environment.




view larger 
Tru-Form Pro Keyboard has an ergonomic 3-D contoured split key design for extra comfort for your arm and wrist and a built-in touchpad that acts as your mouse, avoiding clutter and saving desk space. The touchpad includes the full cursor features, such as left and right mouse buttons and scrolling feature, plus a built-in wrist support for added comfort. The Adesso Tru-Form Pro also includes Multimedia and Internet Hotkeys so you can instantly access your multimedia tools and Internet applications. 

 Tru-Form Pro 308 - Contoured Ergonomic Keyboard with Built-In Touchpad Features

 * Split-Key Ergonomic Keyboard
 * Centered 2.3” x 1.8” Built-in Touch Pad with Scrolling Feature
 * 11 Hotkeys (3 Internet, 5 Multimedia, 3 Power-Saving)
 * Wrist Pad for extra comfort when typing or resting
 * Power, Sleep, and Wake-Up Buttons





view larger Split-Key Ergonomic Keyboard
• Split-key, 3D Design guides your hands and fingers into just the right, natural typing position
• Type as you would normally using the familiar keyboard layout 

view larger Built-in Touchpad 
• Centered for comfort, with 2 buttons & scrolling feature
• Eliminates a need for a mouse or extra space 

view larger  • Multimedia Hotkeys and Power-saving Features
• Has a Sleep and Wake Up Mode that helps save energy 
• Has Power On/Off switch to save extra energy 

view larger Built-in Palm Rest
• Gives your palm a place of rest when typing or not typing

view larger COMPATIBILITY







What is in the box?
• Tru-Form Pro Keyboard 
• Quickstart Guide 





Works with:
• Windows-based PC: Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, 8
• USB port
• CD-ROM drive or Internet connection

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Introducing the new and improved Tru-Formª Pro Keyboard by Adesso¨. The new Tru-Formª Pro Keyboard is contoured and has a split key design for added ergonomic comfort and it includes a built-in touchpad that acts as your mouse. It is Windows Vista compatible and comes with an advanced Glidepoint¨ Touchpad driver for horizontal and vertical scrolling. The touchpad also includes Left and Right mouse buttons providing full cursor features and a built-in wrist support for added comfort. The Adesso¨ Tru-Formª Pro also includes Multimedia and Windows hotkeys so you can instantly access your multimedia tools and popular Windows applications. Windows 7, Vista, XP and 2000
